t: University of Oklahoma Press - Wikipedia
s: February 3, 2025 - The University of Oklahoma Press (OU Press) is the publishing arm of the University of Oklahoma. Founded in 1929 by the fifth president of the University of Oklahoma, William Bennett Bizzell, it was the first university press to be established in the American Southwest.

t: University of Oklahoma Press | The Encyclopedia of Oklahoma History and Culture
s: The OU Press was the idea of William ... of Oklahoma's fifth president. Bizzell's idea was ambitious. With OU Press, he established the first university press in the American Southwest and only the fourth in the American West. By 1929 a press staff was in place, including its first director, Rhodes Scholar and Tulsa Tribune city editor Joseph A. Brandt...
